Text: Hear my cry, O God; attend to my prayer.
Context: The psalmist is calling out to God in a personal plea for attention in a time of need.

Text: From the ends of the earth I call to You when my heart is faint; lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
Context: The psalmist expresses trust in God that He will provide stability and refuge, despite feeling overwhelmed and distant.

Text: For You have been my refuge, a strong tower against the enemy.
Context: The speaker acknowledges God's past protection and expresses gratitude for His steadfast presence.

Text: Let me dwell in Your tent forever and take refuge under the shelter of Your wings. Selah
Context: The psalmist desires an intimate and perpetual communion with God, symbolized by dwelling in His tent.

Text: For You, God, have heard my vows; You have given me the heritage of those who fear Your name.
Context: Recognition of God's response to the speaker's commitments and His provision of a spiritual inheritance among the faithful.

Text: Increase the days of the king's life, his years for many generations.
Context: A prayer for the longevity and stable reign of the king, likely reflecting a time of political stability or transition.

Text: May he sit enthroned before God forever; appoint Your love and faithfulness to protect him.
Context: A blessing for the king, asking for God's presence and steadfast love to be the king's safeguard.

Text: Then I will sing praise to Your name forever, that I may fulfill my vows day after day.
Context: A commitment by the psalmist to perpetual worship and the faithful fulfilling of vows to God as a response to His enduring love.
